title: Marinated Swordfish & Tomato Salad With Sizzling Garlic
summary: Need a gluten free and dairy free main course? Marinated Swordfish & Tomato Salad With Sizzling Garlic could be an excellent recipe to try. This recipe serves 4. One serving contains 906 calories, 64g of protein, and 48g of fat. For $13.17 per serving, this recipe covers 58% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe from SippitySup has 1 fans. A mixture of wine vinegar, food advertising by, lemon juice, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the food dye you could follow this main course with the Orange Dream Angel Food Cake as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 77%, which is solid. Similar recipes include Marinated Swordfish & Tomato Salad with Sizzling Garlic, Marinated And Glazed Swordfish, and Grilled Italian Marinated Swordfish.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 23 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Depending on the soil and microclimate, Pinot gris varies from a simple everyday wine all the way up to absolute top growths. The warm, sun-exposed vineyards of the Anger sites, with their loamy limestone gravel soils, are a textbook example. The Anger Alto Adige Pinot Grigio has a noble structure, nice balance and fine acidity – making it an absolute pleasure to drink. The strong white goes well with fish and fish soup, guinea fowl breast or veal fillet.
